resources.string:
Psychrometrics is the study of air and water vapor mixtures; temperature, relative humidity and dew point are some common psychrometric properties. Psyc-It gives the user direct access to these and eight additional properties.
 
 Point tab - find psychrometric properties.
 Mixing tab - perform air mixing calculations.
 Process tab - point-to-point load calculations.
 Settings tab - set start up defaults.
 
 To use Psyc-It set input property types using the button to the right of each value. Enter input property values. Results update immediately upon any change.
 
 'Exceeds Limits' is displayed if the calculation is beyond limits or unavailable.
 
 Air and Water Vapor Properties in Psyc-It
 Psychrometric -
 ....°Fdb / °Cdb - Dry Bulb Temperature
 ....°Fwb / °Cwb - Wet Bulb Temperature
 ....%RH - Relative Humidity
 ....Btu/lb / kJ/kg - Enthalpy
 ....°Fdp / °Cdp - Dew Point Temperature
 ....gr/lb / g/kg - Humidity Ratio
 ....ft≥/lb - m≥/kg - Specific Volume
 ....in Hg VP / mm Hg VP - Vapor Pressure
 ....lb/ft³ / kg/m³ - Density
 ....PPMw - Parts Per Million by weight
 ....PPMv - Parts Per Million by volume
 ....gr/ft³ / g/m³ - Absolute Humidity
 
 Pressure -
 ....Alt in Ft / m - Altitude (elevation).
 ....psia / kPa - Absolute Pressure.
 
 Psyc-It Limits -
 Dry bulb Temperature: °F / °C
 ....-80 to 1500 / -62.2 to 815.5
 Dew Point Temperature: °F / °C 
 ....-80 to 200 / -62.2 to 93.3
 Absolute Pressure: psia / kPa 
 ....0.7 to 400 13.8 to 2757
 
 Psyc-It uses the same psychrometric function calculation engine developed by Jim Judge, PE for Linric Company products such as PsyCalc® and PsycPro®.
 
 Because all calculations that model physical phenomenon are to some extent approximations users should always check to see that tools such as Psyc-It return results accurate enough for the users needs.
